dataPrivacySecurity.collectsPII: PII data is collected and stored but NOT distributed.
dataPrivacySecurity.dataPrivacySecurity: GENis stores the information in a PostgreSQL database installed on a Debian platform, taking advantage of the security schemes of both systems. During the use of GENis only users with the appropriate permissions can consult the information.

userContent.contentManagement: Content is NOT collected NOT stored and NOT distributed.

name: GENis
description:
GENis is an open source multi-tier information system developed to run a forensic DNA database at local, regional and national levels. It is composed by three
different modules related to: (a) person identification and analysis of
forensic evidence,(b) missing person identification (MPI) and (c)Disaster
victim identification (DVI).

sdgs.sdg: SDG16: Peace¸ Justice and Strong Institutions
sdgs.relevance:
High levels of armed violence and insecurity have a destructive impact on a country’s development. Sexual violence, crime, exploitation and torture are prevalent where there is conflict or no rule of law. Governments, civil society and communities need to work together to find lasting solutions to conflict and insecurity. Strengthening the rule of law and promoting human rights is key to this process, as is reducing the flow of illicit arms, combating corruption, and ensuring inclusive participation at all times.

Forensic DNA databases constitute an important investigative resource in contemporary criminal justice systems. The centralized and computerized storage of DNA profiles in a database enables the systematic comparison and automated matching of crime scene samples and individual profiles. When DNA profiling is used wisely it can help to convict recidivist criminals or exonerate people who are innocent. GENis is an open source software that has been developed to help organize and manage such forensic DNA databases. 

The system was entirely developed with strict adherence to open source policies to encourage the application of auditing procedures, and to warrant the integrity and ownership of the stored data. In addition, the development team followed the recommendations of the International Society of Forensic Genetics and the technical software specifications have been under exhaustive consistency examination by many different argentine universities and R&D centers.
